metadata.Title: CVE-2020-26117 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In rfb/CSecurityTLS.cxx and rfb/CSecurityTLS.java in TigerVNC before 1.11.0, viewers mishandle TLS certificate exceptions. They store the certificates as authorities, meaning that the owner of a certificate could impersonate any server after a client had added an exception.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-26117` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

tigervnc-common - 1.10.1+dfsg-9
tigervnc-scraping-server - 1.10.1+dfsg-9
tigervnc-standalone-server - 1.10.1+dfsg-9
tigervnc-tools - 1.10.1+dfsg-9
tigervnc-viewer - 1.10.1+dfsg-9
tigervnc-xorg-extension - 1.10.1+dfsg-9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tigervnc package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.1+dfsg-9').
